main event: A bright, white streak-like object was observed in the sky over Los Alamos, New Mexico for 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object grew brighter and then went completely out, appearing to 'go out like a light'.
The object was smaller than a grapefruit in size and moved at an insignificant initial speed.
The observer, whose reliability was considered good, could not ascertain if the object made any sound.
The object appeared to be east of the observer's location, traversing northward.
The object's behavior and characteristics did not match any known aircraft, leading the observer to believe it was potentially a meteor.
sighted object: a bright, white streak-like object in the sky
